subject: Re: [junit] OT: Streams / Readers/ Writers or files, what do you use and how do you test?
msgSnippet: ... It s not a matter of preference.  Sometimes I work with streams, sometimes I work with File objects and sometimes, I just want the content of the file as
messageBody:
On 7/26/06, Joakim Ohlrogge <joakim.ohlrogge@...> wrote:
>
>
> What do people on the list prefer? Working with Files or
> Streams/Readers/Writers? For what reasons?
> Please share your thoughts.


It's not a matter of preference. Sometimes I work with streams, sometimes I
work with File objects and sometimes, I just want the content of the file as
an array of strings or as one big String. It's unfortunate that the latter
is still not supported in the JDK.

By the way, my name is Cédric, not Cederic :-)

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
